35232142: Flooding in Newton Stewart and Peeblesshire causes damage, disruption, and prompts calls for improved flood defenses and prevention plans.
40143035: Two tour buses were deliberately set on fire in a hotel car park in Northern Ireland, destroying passengers' belongings and delaying their trip.
35951548: Lewis Hamilton secured pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix, with Nico Rosberg in second, as Ferrari's challenge faded in the final laps.
36266422: John Edward Bates, a former scout leader, faces 22 charges of sexual abuse against four male complainants between 1972 and 1989, which he denies.
38826984: A young police officer receiving psychiatric treatment at Cerahpasa hospital in Istanbul threatened to shoot himself and others, leading to the evacuation of patients and staff.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors secured a bonus-point victory over Newport Gwent Dragons in the Guinness Pro12, winning 29-15 with tries from Chris Fusaro, Zander Fagerson, Junior Bulumakau, and Simone Favaro.

35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie dies after colliding with a motorbike during Gent-Wevelgem race, sparking safety concerns and investigation.
40758845: Manchester City midfielder Ilkay Gundogan is confident the club can challenge for the Premier League title this season, as he nears a return from a serious knee injury.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to hospital with a head injury and suspected multiple fractures after a crash on the A127 in Essex.
34615665: Hurricane Patricia, the strongest storm ever recorded, hits Mexico, prompting Newsround reporter Jenny Lawrence to explain tropical storm categories and their implications.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks discovered vulnerabilities in wireless mice that could allow attackers to spoof signals and gain control of a computer.
37922330: Murray and Burrell, a Galashiels-based business, went into administration, resulting in 38 job losses, but some workers may find employment at a nearby Melrose building firm.

30816523: Max Mosley sues Google over photos from a sex party, seeking to block their appearance in search results, arguing that the company should operate within the law and respect court judgments.
38900884: Dragons' flanker Ollie Griffiths to miss rest of season due to knee injury, creating opportunities for other players.
13890581: The UK government has provided a three-year funding package to support the Cornish language, which is classified as "critically endangered" by the United Nations.
40194700: Monaco's manager Leonardo Jardim, who led the team to the French title and Champions League semi-finals, signs a new contract extension despite receiving offers from other clubs.

36052570: Oil nations meet to discuss production freeze, but skepticism remains over its impact on oversupply, causing energy sector stocks to fall.
34944735: A study found that tarantulas evolved a bright blue color at least eight times independently, suggesting the hue serves an important visual function, possibly for camouflage or warning potential predators.

34988915: DJ Neil Fox denies sexual assault allegations, claiming "horseplay" in the workplace was consensual and his behavior has not changed despite evolving workplace norms.
37889203: Tottenham Hotspur's Dele Alli will miss England's upcoming games against Scotland and Spain due to a knee injury sustained in training.
33609927: Jehovah's Witnesses' explicit policy of dealing with child abuse allegations in-house has led to a reluctance to co-operate with secular justice, as seen in the case of a man who sexually abused two women but faced no punishment from the organization.

31723471: Manor F1 team secures investment from energy firm Ovo's boss Stephen Fitzpatrick and announces Will Stevens as one of their drivers for the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government and Liberal Democrats agreed on a £39m stimulus package to boost the economy, but opposition parties criticized the plan as inadequate.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister Sir John Major warns that Brexit will be a "historic mistake" and calls for "more charm and a lot less cheap rhetoric" from the government in EU negotiations.

36832879: A collapsed sewer under train tracks in Forest Hill is causing major disruption to Southern, Thameslink and London Overground services, expected to last until Wednesday.
14958201: Substitute Mario Balotelli's goal and James Milner's late strike helped Manchester City overcome Everton's defensive tactics to secure a 2-0 win and move top of the Premier League.

39939090: Rangi Chase joins bottom-of-the-table Widnes after being dropped by Castleford, with coach Denis Betts excited to sign the former England playmaker.
29347771: Cricket Scotland chief executive Roddy Smith announces departure after 10 years, leaving the organization in good health with increased participation and a place in the World Cup finals.

35550407: Life expectancy among older age groups in England rose to its highest level in 2014, but concerns grow over regional variations and elderly people living in poor health.

36418082: Germany leaves out injured Reus and includes Schweinsteiger for Euro 2016 squad.

35884842: Private Paul Wilkinson testified he spoke to Private Cheryl James about her relationships 20 minutes before her death at Deepcut barracks in 1995.

39038936: News organisations sue FBI for details on how it unlocked San Bernardino killer's iPhone, arguing public has right to know.
38735486: Vern Cotter reflects on his time coaching in France and Scotland, as he prepares for his final Six Nations campaign before returning to France to coach Montpellier.

39088847: Labour criticizes government changes to Personal Independence Payments, arguing that 160,000 people will lose benefits, while the government claims the changes will ensure maximum support for those most in need.
